### Minting With Kuber
For minting with kuber one can use "mint" key containing script and amount to be minted as shown in the examples below.

#### 1. Signature  Policy

Here simple policy script specifying key-hash indicating who can mint the tokens using the following policy script. selections contain the address from which utxos to be selected. Output contains address where the token is to be minted in which the value specifies new value, policy id and required asset name. Policy id for the script can be obtained from the kuber api using /api/v1/policy and passing script to request body.
```json

{
    "selections": [
        "<Type your address from which utxos are selected while creating transaction.>"
    ],
    "output":[
       {
            "address": "addr_test1vp42v5cge967qqq3rsqx77cmh8avuyx7d53der7pzhlmcsck2gc6n",
            "value": "1 <policy_id>.<asset_name> + 1  31b0b0702f5d5432053586adfa15f3d1bdf83f57152ba7f371addf00.546f6b656e32"
       }
    ],
    "mint": [
        {
            "script": {
                "type": "sig",
                "keyHash": "<Enter key hash here> eg.6c68d85ae54204a77c2b20928e027b5d5c88603445d8cbe28bcc679f"
            },
            "amount": {
                "Token1": 1,
                "Token2": 2
            }
        }
    ]
}
 ```
#### 2. Timelock Policy
It is same as above except it contains script using time lock policy in mint field.
```json

{
    "selections": [
        "<Type your address from which utxos are selected while creating transaction.>"
    ],
    "output":[
       {
            "address": "addr_test1vp42v5cge967qqq3rsqx77cmh8avuyx7d53der7pzhlmcsck2gc6n",
            "value": "1 <policy_id>.<asset_name> + 1  31b0b0702f5d5432053586adfa15f3d1bdf83f57152ba7f371addf00.546f6b656e32"
       }
    ],
    "mint": [
        {
            "script": {
                "type": "before",
                "slot": 3000
            },
            "amount": {
                "Token1": 1,
                "Token2": 2
            }
        }
    ]
}
 ```

#### 3. Complex Policy (all/any)
Here the policy script contains key hash and time lock both.

```json
{
    "selections": [
        "<Type your address from which utxos are selected while creating transaction.>"
    ],
    "output": [
        {
            "address": "addr_test1vp42v5cge967qqq3rsqx77cmh8avuyx7d53der7pzhlmcsck2gc6n",
            "value": "1 <policy_id>.<asset_name> + 1  31b0b0702f5d5432053586adfa15f3d1bdf83f57152ba7f371addf00.546f6b656e32"
        }
    ],
    "mint": [
        {
            "script": {
                "scripts": [
                    {
                        "keyHash": "966e394a544f242081e41d1965137b1bb412ac230d40ed5407821c37",
                        "type": "sig"
                    },
                    {
                        "slot": 3000,
                        "type": "before"
                    }
                ],
                "type": "all"
            },
            "amount": {
                "Token1": 1,
                "Token2": 2
            }
        }
    ]
}
 ```

#### 4. Plutus script
Here the script used in plutus script in the format given below on mint field. Plutus script requires an additional field as redeemer which is to be passed on another "redeemer" field.
```json

{
    "selections": [
        "<Type your address from which utxos are selected while creating transaction.>"
    ],
    "output":[
       {
            "address": "addr_test1vp42v5cge967qqq3rsqx77cmh8avuyx7d53der7pzhlmcsck2gc6n",
            "value": "1 <policy_id>.<asset_name> + 1  31b0b0702f5d5432053586adfa15f3d1bdf83f57152ba7f371addf00.546f6b656e32"
       }
    ],
    "mint": [
        {
            "script": {
                "type": "PlutusScriptV1",
                "description": "",
                "cborHex": ""
            },
            "redeemer": 2,
            "amount": {
                "Token1": 1,
                "Token2": 2
            }
        }
    ]
}
 ```
